title: What is garens ACTUAL weakness
body:
First off, im not saying garen is op, i just want to know what his ACTUAL weakness is. Everyone says he can be "easily kited" but thats kind of bullshit as he can easily run up and you with his q then no more kiting since you cant use abilities. Even if you do have a speed up, garen can usually catch up to you and is too tanky to kill just kiting, even with LDR. If he gets on you, your as good as dead, so i dont know what im supposed to do.

EDIT: I was playing Miss Fortune. Keep that in mind.

DOUBLE EDIT: Part of the reason im asking this is because i just threw a game real hard but im not sure how. One second Garen was like 2/5 and the next he was this tanky bruiser who was the literal embodiment of sanic (who seemed to always have flash up just to kill me). He always one shot me and I literally could do nothing but take it, as I did no damage back, even with LDR and black cleaver.

Is this post real?

Why does the boards have to be like this. Can I not ask a question without condescending passive aggressive comments? Maybe instead of writing a 4 word reply to farm likes, actually contribute to the discussion. Sure maybe I'm not diamond, but how else am I supposed to ever learn? How is anyone supposed to learn if they are scared to ask a damn question because they think it's "stupid". Or am I now not allowed to ask questions? I'm sorry that I'm not as prodigious as you dear sir. If someone has a question they have a right to ask it without having to deal with this shit. If this were an opinion thread about a champion being too Op or whatever, id be fine with you disagreeing with me, but these comments that add nothing to discussion and are passive aggressive are just pointless. I can't see anyone else sticking up for me as a very kind boards member did long ago so I must stick up for myself. So to answer your question, yes, this post is very much real.
It's a bit stupid, but I think it might just be an inexperienced player asking for help on the boards.

The easiest way to beat Garen is to group up early.  Unless his opponent feeds him in lane, he isn't very good at team fighting against a competent team.  The only thing he can do is bum rush the enemy which simply doesn't work as an engage.  As soon as he bum rushes he is easy to pick off because he isn't a true engager like Amumu or Sejuani.
I mean, do you focus him though? cause if you  dont hes probably going to take out at least one carry

It depends on who your team is.  If you have a high damage team lacking a tank then you need to focus him down.  If you have a high cc tank then you put that tank on him to CC him while the rest of your team focuses on Garen's carries.  What I typically see Garen do is run ahead of his team with his 600+ movement speed creating a momentary 1vs5.  He is easy to focus down during this time before his team gets there.

If he is the biggest threat to you at the moment, then yes. People tell ADC's to never attack the tanks, but that logic is flawed and stupid. If the tank is currently the biggest threat, go ahead and attack it. (I know Garen is a juggernaut, but he still builds defensive. Pls no flame me.)

very debatable, Darius's 2 slows and a pull are far better sticking power than Garen's MS boost

you could argue that Garen has an easier time _getting_ to someone but when it comes to actually staying in once you're there Darius blows Garen out of the water

I've found that Darius is more dangerous if he does catch you, but the lack of CC removal and move speed, Garen sticks on harder because he can get to you easier.

Just using a very simple, but common example, Ezreal with IBG will easily get away from Darius while he won't get away from Garen so easily.

Against, say, Braum, Darius will be far more dangerous than Garen because neither will really struggle to get to him, but Darius will keep you near him.
He can be kited.

Poor positioning and poor use of cooldowns will make Garen seem like an unstoppable monster.

If you're playing MF, for example, hold your E until he presses Q then he's stuck.
